channel.title: Sep
channel.description: Day By Day VA Family-Literacy Calendar

item.title: September Monthly Activities
item.description:
Books to Read!

• Time For A Bath by Steve Jenkins and Robin Page
• Bathtime For Biscuit by Alyssa Satin Capucilli and Pat Schories
• It's Bath Time Baby by Tasha Fuller and Christiana Sandoval
• Just Go To Bed by Mercer Mayer
• A Potty For Me by Karen Katz
• Brush, Brush, Brush! by Alicia Padron and Children's Press
• Never Talk To Strangers by Irma Joyce and George Buckett
• My Manners Matter by Pat Thomas and Lesley Harker
• Sleep Like A Tiger by Mary Logue and Pamela Zagarenski
• I Will Never Not Eat A Tomato by Lauren Child
• Why Do Leaves Change Color? by Betsy Maestro and Loretta Krupinski
• My Very First Book of Numbers by Eric Carle
• Dog Loves Counting by Louise Yates
• Fall Leaves by Loretta Holland and Elly MacKay
• Fancy Nancy and the Fall Foliage by Jane O'Connor and Robin Preiss Glasser
• Let It Fall by Maryann Cocca-Leffler
• Mouse's First Fall by Lauren Thompson and Buket Erdogan
• The Busy Little Squirrel by Nancy Tafuri
• Fletcher and the Falling Leaves by Julia Rawlinson and Tiphanie Beeke
• The Itsy Bitsy Pumpkin by Sonali Fry and Sanja Rescek
• Pinkalicious and the Pink Pumpkin by Victoria Kann
• Clementine, Friend of the Week by Sara Pennypacker and Marla Frazee
• Don't Need Friends by Carolyn Crimi
• A Friend For Dragon by Dav Pilkey
• Alphabet by Matthew Van Fleet
• Alpha Oops!: The Day Z Went First by Alethea Kontis and Bob Kolar
• The Alphabet Book by P. D. Eastman
• The Alphabet Tree by Leo Lionni
• Boo's Surprise by Betsy Byars and Erik Brooks

Artwork by Patrick Girouard iREAD 2014 Summer Reading Program

Around VA

Check out Festivals and Events happening in September around the state. What would you like to celebrate this fall?

  • Hillsville Gun Show and Flea Market - Hillsville
  • VFW 1115 Labor Day Flea Market - Hillsville
  • Labor Day Weekend Flea Market - Hillsville
  • 2015 First Friday Fall Art Walk - Martinsville
  • Boardwalk Arts and Crafts Festival - Colonial Beach
  • Taste of the Mountains Main Street Festival - Madison
  • Orange Street Festival - Orange
  • Tidewater Fall Gun and Knife Show - Norfolk
  • Wytheville Fall Farmers Market - Wytheville
  • Virginia Beach Health and Fitness Expo - Virginia Beach
  • Fishersville Indoor Outdoor Market and Yard Sale - Fishersville
  • 2015 Country Fair and Gathering - Big Island
  • Symphony Under the Stars - Chesapeake
  • Herndon Labor Day Festival - Herndon
  • Heritage Harvest Fest - Charlottesville
  • Mathews Market Days - Mathews
  • Olde Salem Days - Salem
  • Bands, Brews, and Barbecue - Manassas
  • Fishersville Fall Gun Show - Fishersville
  • Burke Centre Festival - Burke
  • Fredericksburg Fall Gun Show - Fredericksburg
  • Bassett Heritage Festival - Bassett
  • Chincoteague Island Second Saturday Artful Flea - Chincoteague Island
  • Mid-Autumn Moon Festival - Norfolk
  • Isle of Wight County Fair - Windsor
  • Better Living Home and Garden Expo - Hampton
  • Virginia Beach Fall Town Fair - Virginia Beach
  • Tysons Beer, Bourbon, and BBQ Festival - Tysons
  • ETC Indie Music and Arts Festival - Norfolk
  • Salem Fall Gun and Knife Show - Salem
  • Chantilly Fall Big Flea Market - Chantilly
  • Alexandria King Street Art Festival - Alexandria
  • Manassas Fall Gun Show - Manassas
  • Neptune Festival Arts and Crafts Show - Virginia Beach
  • State Fair of Virginia at the Meadow - Doswell
  • Fall Home and Garden Show - Fredericksburg
  • Guinea Jubilee - Bena
  • New Market Heritage Days Festival - New Market
  • Deltaville Farmers Market - Deltaville
  • Ribtoberfest - Norfolk
  • Workhouse Fall Arts Festival - Lorton
  • Hampton Fall Gun Show - Hampton
  • 2015 Fredericksburg Bead Show - Fredericksburg
  • Historic Occoquan Fall Arts and Crafts Show - Occoquan
  • Rockledge Mansion Fall Arts and Crafts Show - Occoquan
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 30
item.description:
Sing a Song

Criss Cross Apple Sauce

Criss Cross Apple Sauce
Spiders crawling up your back
Spiders here, Spiders there
Spiders even in your hair
Cool breeze, tight squeeze
Now you've got the shiveries

Watch

Skidamarink!

Try This

A is for Apple

Eat an apple together and help your child count the seeds.

TumbleBooks

Always - Alison McGhee

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Make Applesauce at Home - Making applesauce is easy and everyone can help!
  • An Apple a Day - What happens when a hungry artist is painting a group of apples?
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 29
item.description:
Sing a Song

Rain

Rain on the grass,
Rain on the trees,
Rain on the rooftop,
But not on me!
Rain on the grass,
Rain on the trees,
Rain on the windows,
But not on me!

TumbleBooks

Red is a Dragon - Roseanne Thong

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

R is for Ring Around the Rosie

Teach your child the rhyme and actions for this song.


(Everyone hold hands and dance around in a circle.)
Ring around the rosie
A pocketful of posies
"Ashes, Ashes"
We all fall down!
(Everyone fall down)

Watch

Sesame Street: Jane Tuesday: Red Raspberry

Explore More

  • Handprint Rainbow - Everyone in the family can contribute to this enormous art project.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 28
item.description:
Sing a Song

X marks the spot

X marks the spot
With a dot, dot, dot
And a dash, dash, dash
And a big question mark.

Tickle (child's name) up,
Tickle (child's name) down,
Tickle (child's name) all around!

Crack an egg!
Crack another egg!

With a hug,
And a squeeze,
And a tap on your knees.

Make the motions

Watch

African Alphabet

Try This

X is for X-marks-the-spot

Help your child find your country, state, and city on a map. Draw a map of your neighborhood.

TumbleBooks

Pirates Don't Change Diapers - Melinda Long

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • X-ray Animal Art - Make drawings of animals using an x-ray style. Where will you put their bones?
  • Virtual Water Bottle Xylophone - Learn how to make a water bottle xylophone and try the one online!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 27
item.description:
Not Last Night But the Night Before

(Jump Rope Song)

Not last night but the night before,
24 robbers came knocking at my door.
I asked them what they wanted, and this is what they said:

Spanish dancers do the splits, the kicks they turn around, touch the ground.

Spanish Dancer please come back, back, sit on a tack, read a book and do not look,
1, 2, 3, 4... (continue until you miss)

Watch

J Friends

Try This

J is for Jump

Play some jumping games with your child, like leap frog, jump rope, or jumping jacks.

TumbleBooks

Jessie's Island - Sheryl McFarlane

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Jellyfish Coffee Filter Craft - Color a coffee filter for a unique craft project.
  • Jellyfish Coloring Page - Here is a coloring page you can print and color. What color will your jellyfish be?
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 26
item.description:
Sing a Song

Baby Duck

Oh what a bit of luck
That I was born a baby duck
With rubber socks and rubber shoes
I can waddle where I choose
Quack, quack, quack, quack, quack,
Quack, quack, quack, quack, quack.

Oh I don't think it's very funny,
That I was born a baby bunny
With floppy ears and twitchy nose,
I bounce around upon my toes
Bounce, bounce, bounce bounce bounce,
Bounce, bounce, bounce bounce bounce.

I’m a little smelly skunk
Hiding under someone’s bunk.
Nobody wants to play with me,
‘Cause I’m as smelly as can be.
I’m a skunk, I’m a skunk, I’m a skunk, skunk, skunk.
I’m a skunk, I’m a skunk, I’m a skunk, skunk, skunk.

Watch

Rappin’ Alphabet

Try This

Make salt dough

Together, use the dough to spell out the initials or name of your child. Don’t forget to wash hands aftewards!

TumbleBooks

Bad For Them, Good For Me - Aaron Zevy

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Book about Me - Print page templates, help your child fill them in and decorate to make a personalized book.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 25
item.description:
Sing a Song

Kites

Five little kites flying high in the sky
Said, "Hi" to the cloud as it passed by,
Said, "Hi" to the bird, said "Hi" to the sun,
Said, "Hi" to an airplane--oh what fun!
Then whish went the wind,
And they all took a dive:
One, two, three, four, five.

TumbleBooks

Who Likes The Wind? - Etta Kaner

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

K is for Kite

Help your child draw and decorate a kite. Or make a small kite by gluing two popsicle sticks to form an X and gluing paper cut in a diamond shape.

Watch

Sesame Street: Mr. Noodle Flies a Kite

Explore More

  • Make a Kite - Make a multi-colored kite to decorate any room!
  • Make a Kite out of a Plastic Bag - Kids will need some adult help with this activity, but a real kite can be made for flying with everyday household items.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 24
item.description:
Sing a Song

Zum Gali Gali

Zum gali gali gali,
Zum gali gali.
Zum gali gali gali,
Zum gali gali.

Pioneers all work as one,
Work as one all pioneers.
Peace shall be for all the world,
All the world shall be for peace.

Pioneers all work as one,
Work as one all pioneers.
Peace shall be for all the world,
All the world shall be for peace.

Zum gali gali gali,
Zum gali gali.
Zum gali gali gali,
Zum gali gali.

TumbleBooks

Zoe Sophia in New York - Claudia Mauner and Elisa Smalley

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Z is for Zoo

Help your child spell out his or her name with an animal for each letter. Draw these animals to make a zoo.

Watch

Zoo

Explore More

  • Make a Zoo in a Shoe Box - Turn a cardboard box into a miniature menagerie!
  • Riverbanks Zoo and Garden: Animals - Click on each section of the zoo to learn more about the animals that live here.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 23
item.description:
Sing a Song

Take Me Out for Some Ice Cream

Tune: Take Me Out to the Ball Game

Take me out for some ice cream, take me out to the store.
Buy me a triple scoop jumbo cone.
I won't share, I'll eat it alone!
For it's scoop, scoop, scoop up the ice cream -
Give me three kinds I adore!
For it's one, two, three scoops to go
At the ice cream store!

Watch

Soak Up the Sun

Try This

I is for Ice

Melt ice cubes and talk about temperature. Have your child think of two things that are hot and two other things that are cold.

TumbleBooks

I Got Two Dogs - John Lithgow

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Make Ice Cream in a Baggie - If you don’t have an ice cream maker, try this easy recipe.
  • Painting with Ice Cubes - Here is another fun way to paint without brushes!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 22
item.description:
Sing a Song

Yankee Doodle

Yankee Doodle came to town,
Riding on a pony;
He stuck a feather in his cap,
And called it macaroni.

Yankee Doodle keep it up,
Yankee Doodle dandy;
Mind the music and the step,
And with the girls be handy.

TumbleBooks

Yelly Kelly - Nancy Sweetland

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Y is for Yellow

With your child, point out the yellow objects you both see throughout the day.

Watch

Sesame Street: Dancing Petroglyph Y

Explore More

  • 3D Star Paper Craft - You can paint your star yellow or another favorite color.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 21
item.description:
The Umbrella

Young Betty she took an umbrella, umbrella,
Down in the meadows so green.
Goosey Gander came up just to tell her,
To tell her,
That HE owned the meadows so green.

But Betty she spread her umbrella, umbrella,
Till nothing of her could be seen;
And the Goose, he could never compel her,
Compel her,
To run from those meadows so green.

Watch

Numbers in English and Spanish

Try This

U is for Uno

Learn to count to ten in Spanish.
1. uno 6. seis
2. dos 7. siete
3. tres 8. ocho
4. cuatro 9. nueve
5. cinco 10. diez

TumbleBooks

Señor Felipe's Alphabet Adventure : El Alfabeto Español - Sharon Hawkins Vargo

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Spring Flowers - This flower picture can be made any time of the year!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 20
item.description:
Sing a Song

We're going on a treasure hunt
X marks the spot
Three lines down, with a dot, dot, dot.

Comma, comma, question mark
Exclamation point

With a pinch
And a squeeze
And a tropical breeze

Now you've got the shivers!
Learn how to do the motions

TumbleBooks

How I Became a Pirate - Melinda Long

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

T is for Treasure Hunt

Help your child find objects around the house that start with each letter of the alphabet.

Watch

I’m a Little Teapot

Explore More

  • Make a Treasure Chest - Make your very own treasure chest. What treasures will you put in the box?
  • Have a Treasure Hunt - Plan a treasure hunt indoors or in the back yard!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 19
item.description:
Did You Ever See a Lassie

Did you ever see a lassie,
A lassie, a lassie?
Did you ever see a lassie,
Go this way and that?
Go this way and that way,
Go this way and that way.
Did you ever see a lassie,
Go this way and that?

Did you ever see a laddie,
A laddie, a laddie?
Did you ever see a laddie,
Go this way and that?
Go this way and that way,
Go this way and that way.
Did you ever see a laddie,
Go this way and that?

Learn how to do the actions

TumbleBooks

Duck! Rabbit! - Amy Krouse Rosenthal

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

D is for Dig

Fill a small container with dirt and hide objects in it. Have your child dig to find the objects.

Watch

Sesame Street: Telly and the Letter D

Explore More

  • Bill, the Big-Mouthed Duck - A few paper plates can turn into a big-mouthed friend!
  • Dot Drawing - Click on each number in order to discover the picture.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 18
item.description:
Oh, Susanna

I come from Alabama
With my banjo on my knee,
I'm going to Louisiana,
My true love for to see.

Oh, Susanna,
Oh don't you cry for me,
For I come from Alabama,
With my banjo on my knee.

It rained all night
The day I left
The weather it was dry
The sun so hot,
I froze to death
Susanna, don't you cry.

Oh, Susanna,
Oh don't you cry for me,
For I come from Alabama,
With my banjo on my knee.

I had a dream the other night,
When everything was still,
I thought I saw Susanna,
A-coming down the hill.

Oh, Susanna,
Oh don't you cry for me,
For I come from Alabama,
With my banjo on my knee.

The buckwheat cake,
Was in her mouth,
The tear was
In her eye,
Says I, I'm coming from the south,
Susanna, don't you cry.

Oh, Susanna,
Oh don't you cry for me,
For I come from Alabama,
With my banjo on my knee.

Watch

The Letter O

Try This

O is for Origami

Origami is the Japanese art of making objects by folding paper. Help your child make a paper airplane.

TumbleBooks

Ook the Book - Lissa Roverch

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Opposites - Watch and listen to this storybook about opposites.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 17
item.description:
Sing a Song

The Vowel Song

Tune: Bingo

The vowels of the alphabet
I know them all by name, oh!
a-e-i-o-u
a-e-i-o-u
a-e-i-o-u
I know them all by name, oh!

The vowels of the alphabet
I know them all by name, oh!
[clap]-e-i-o-u
[clap]-e-i-o-u
[clap]-e-i-o-u
I know them all by name, oh!

The vowels of the alphabet
I know them all by name, oh!
[clap]-[clap]-i-o-u
[clap]-[clap]-i-o-u
[clap]-[clap]-i-o-u
I know them all by name, oh!

The vowels of the alphabet
I know them all by name, oh!
[clap]-[clap]-[clap}-o-u
[clap]-[clap]-[clap}-o-u
[clap]-[clap]-[clap}-o-u
I know them all by name, oh!

The vowels of the alphabet
I know them all by name, oh!
[clap]-[clap]-[clap}-[clap]-u
[clap]-[clap]-[clap}-[clap]-u
[clap]-[clap]-[clap}-[clap]-u
I know them all by name, oh!

The vowels of the alphabet
I know them all by name, oh!
[clap]-[clap]-[clap}-[clap]-[clap]
[clap]-[clap]-[clap}-[clap]-[clap]
[clap]-[clap]-[clap}-[clap]-[clap]
[clap]-[clap]-[clap}-[clap]-[clap]

Watch

When Two Vowels Go Walking (Between the Lions)

Try This

Vowels!

Check out Chicka Chicka Boom Boom from your library. Create a coconut tree with only vowels at the top of the tree.

TumbleBooks

Odd Velvet - Mary E. Whitcomb

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Saying More Words - Here are great tips on helping your child develop a strong and varied vocabulary.
  • Make a Word - Can you make all the words on the word list by dragging the vowels?
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 16
item.description:
Sing a Song

Paw Paw Patch

Where, oh where, oh where is Susie?
Where, oh where, oh where is Susie?
Where, oh where, oh where is Susie?
Way down yonder in the paw-paw patch.

Come on, kids, let's go find her,
Come on, kids, let's go find her,
Come on, kids, let's go find her,
Way down yonder in the paw-paw patch.

Pickin' up paw-paws, puttin' 'em in your pockets,
Pickin' up paw-paws, puttin' 'em in your pockets,
Pickin' up paw-paws, puttin' 'em in your pockets,
Way down yonder in the paw-paw patch.

TumbleBooks

The Paper Bag Princess - Robert Munsch

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

P is for Pat-a-cake

Pat-a-cake, pat-a-cake,
baker's man,
Bake me a cake
as fast as you can.
Roll it, and prick it,
and mark it with a "B"
And put it in the oven
for Baby and me!

Watch

Pat-a-Cake

Explore More

  • The Princess and the Pea - Watch, listen, and read along with this classic story.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 15
item.description:
Sing a Song

ABC Phonics Parade

Apple, Apple, A, a, a,
Bear, Bear, B, b, b,
Cat, Cat, C, c, c,
Dog, Dog, D, d, d,
Elephant, Elephant, E, e, e,
Fish, Fish, F, f, f,
Gate, Gate, G, g, g,
Hat, Hat, H, h, h,
Igloo, Igloo, I, i, i,
Jack-in-the-box, Jack-in-the-box, J, j, j,
Kite, Kite, K, k, k,
Leaf, Leaf, L, l, l,
Moon, Moon, M, m, m,
Nest, Nest, N, n, n,
Octopus, Octopus, O, o, o,
Pig, Pig, P, p, p,
Queen, Queen, Qu, qu, qu,
Ring, Ring, R, r, r,
Sun, Sun, S, s, s,
Turtle, Turtle, T, t, t,
Umbrella, Umbrella, U, u, u,
Vacuum, Vacuum, V, v, v,
Window, Window, W, w, w,
X-ray, X-ray, X, x, x,
Yo-yo, Yo-yo, Y, y, y,
Zipper, Zipper, Z, z, z!

Watch

Sesame Street: Captain Vegetable

Try This

V is for Vegetables

Name a vegetable that starts with each letter of the alphabet.

TumbleBooks

Bebe Goes Shopping - Susan Middleton Elya

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Make Your Own Potato Head! - You don’t need a real potato for this craft--just a paper bag or brown construction paper.
  • The Back Porch Activity Pages - Print and color these fun activities about fruits, vegetables, and other foods you eat.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 14
item.description:
Sing a Song

My Hat, It Has Three Corners

My hat, it has three corners,
Three corners has my hat,
And had it not three corners,
It would not be my hat.
There are some actions that go with this song.

TumbleBooks

The Hockey Card - Avi Slodovnick and Jack Siemiatycki

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

H is for Hat

Have your child use different household objects as hats and see how long they can stay on his or her head. Draw self-portraits with your child where you are each wearing a silly hat.

Watch

PBS Kids: Cat in the Hat Hiding Tricks

Explore More

  • Draw a Silly Hat - Use this online drawing pad to draw a hat or other object that starts with H. (how about a hippo?)
  • Samurai Hat - Here is another newspaper hat to decorate and wear!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 13
item.description:
Sing a Song

If you're happy and you know it,
Clap your hands.
If you're happy and you know it,
Clap your hands.
If you're happy and you know it,
then your face will surely show it.
If you're happy and you know it
Clap your hands.

Now sing it again with these actions:
stomp your feet
wave your arms
shout hooray

TumbleBooks

Once Upon A Breath - Aaron Zevy

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

M is for Music

Teach your child to sing the alphabet to the tune of Mary Had a Little Lamb.
Try using the same tune to sing this Mother Goose rhyme:

Great A, little a, bouncing B! The cat’s in the cupboard and can’t see me.

Make up some hand motions together.

Watch

Mary Had a Pretty Bird

Explore More

  • Alphabet Doors - Click on each door to discover what’s behind the letter.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 12
item.description:
Little Rabbit Foo Foo

Little Bunny Foo-Foo
Went hopping through the forest
Scooping up the field mice
And bopping them on the head.

Down came the good fairy and
Said Little Bunny Foo-Foo
I don't want to see you
Scooping up the field mice
And bopping them on the head.

I'll give you three chances.
Little Bunny Foo-Foo
Went hopping through the forest
Scooping up the field mice
And bopping them on the head.

Down came the good fairy
And said Little Bunny Foo-Foo
I don't want to see you
Scooping up the field mice
And bopping them on the head.

I'll give you two chances.
Little Bunny Foo-Foo
Went hopping through the forest
Scooping up the field mice
And bopping them on the head.

Down came the good fairy
And said Little Bunny Foo-Foo
I don't want to see you
Scooping up the field mice
And bopping them on the head.

I'll give you one last chance.
Little Bunny Foo-Foo
Went hopping through the forest
Scooping up the field mice
And bopping them on the head.

Down came the good fairy
And said Little Bunny Foo-Foo
I already told you to stop
Scooping up the field mice
And bopping them on the head.
Poof – you're a mouse.

Watch

Ladybug! Ladybug

Try This

L is for Leaves

Take a walk outside and find leaves. Try to find ten different kinds of leaves and three different colors of leaves.

TumbleBooks

A Home for Pearl Squirrel - Amy Crane Johnson

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Make a Litterbug - Don’t throw away egg cartons--use them to make a crafty bug friend.
  • Leaf Art - Make a leafy window pane to decorate any room in the house!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 11
item.description:
Sing a Song

Gregory Griggs

Gregory Griggs, Gregory Griggs,
Had twenty-seven different wigs.
He wore them up, he wore them down
To please the people of the town.
He wore them east,
He wore them west,
But he never could tell which one he loved best.

TumbleBooks

I Love Saturdays y Domingos - Alma Flor Ada

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

G is for Grandparents

Tell your child a story about his or her grandparents or have a grandparent tell a childhood story.

Watch

Little Red Riding Hood

Explore More

  • Family Game Memories - Ask everyone in the family what their favorite game is and record the answers in a book or other work of art.
  • “When I was Young” Book - Kids can interview their parents or grandparents and present them with a book of memories.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 10
item.description:
Sing a Song

Winkum

Winkum, winkum, shut your eyes,
While I sing sweet lullabies,
For the dew is falling soft,
Lights are flick'ring up aloft,
And the moon is peeping over
Yonder hilltop, capped with clover.

Chickens long have gone to rest,
Birds lie snug within their nest,
And my darling soon will be
Sleeping like a chickadee;
For with only half a try,
Winkum, Winkum shuts her eyes.

Winkum, Winkum shut your eyes.

TumbleBooks

The Wedding - Eve Bunting

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

W is for Wash

Make paint with shaving cream and a few drops of food coloring. Let your child paint with it in the tub during bath time, and then wash it all away.

Watch

Wombat Might

Explore More

  • Make Waxed Paper Stained Glass - Customize your stained glass with leaves, crayon shavings, glitter, or other flat art ideas.
  • How People Make Wagons - Come along with Mister Rogers and learn how wagons are made.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 9
item.description:
Sing a Song

She Sells Seashells

Try this tongue twister!

She sells seashells,
By the seashore.
The shells she sells,
Are surely seashells.

So if she sells shells,
On the seashore,
I'm sure she sells,
Seashore shells.

TumbleBooks

Sammy Spider's First Shabbat - Sylvia A. Rouss

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

S is for Sign Language

Explain the idea of sign language to your child. He or she already knows how to say hello and goodbye by waving. Teach him or her how to say “I love you.”

Watch

Goldilocks and the Three Bears in Sign Language

Explore More

  • S for Sandwich - Here is a video from Sesame Street all about the letter S!
  • Sea Shell Crafts - If you have collected sea shells this summer, here are some craft ideas for showing them off.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 8
item.description:
Sing a Song

Going on a Bear Hunt

We're goin' on a bear hunt,
We're going to catch a big one,
I'm not scared
What a beautiful day!
Oh look! It's some long, wavy grass!
Can't go over it,
Can't go under it,
Can't go around it,
Got to go through it!
(Make arm motions like you're going through long grass and make swishing sounds.)

We're goin' on a bear hunt,
We're going to catch a big one,
I'm not scared
What a beautiful day!
Oh look! It's a mushroom patch.
Can't go over it,
Can't go under it,
Can't go around it,
Got to go through it!
(Pretend to go through the patch making popping sounds by clasping fingers together and clapping hands.)

We're goin' on a bear hunt,
We're going to catch a big one,
I'm not scared
What a beautiful day!
Oh look! It's a wide river.
Can't go over it,
Can't go under it,
Can't go through it,
Got to swim across it.
(Pretend to swim and make splashing sounds.)

We're goin' on a bear hunt,
We're going to catch a big one,
I'm not scared
What a beautiful day!
Oh look! A deep, dark cave.
Can't go over it,
Can't go under it,
Can't go through it,
Got to go in it.
(Pretend you're in a cave)

Uh, oh! It's dark in here.
I feel something,
It has lots of hair!
It has sharp teeth!
It's a bear!

Hurry back through the river,
(Pretend to swim and make splashing sounds)
Back through the mushroom patch,
(Make popping sounds)
Back through the long grass
(Make motions like you're going through grass and make swishing sounds)
Run in the house and lock the door.
(Make a loud clap sound.)
Phew! That was close!
I'm not afraid!

For slightly different lyrics, try the Bus Song site.

Watch

B.B. King: The Letter B

Try This

Put your hands together like a bee hive and say...
This is my bee hive,
but where are the bees?
Hidden inside where nobody sees. One, two, three, four,
five Pop fingers up while counting
They bzzzzzzz away to the trees!

TumbleBooks

The Bumblebee Queen - April Pulley Sayre

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Going on a Bear Hunt - Watch this exciting video where the classic song is played on kazoos!
  • Bumblebee Puppet - Make a bumblebee puppet using a paper bag!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 7
item.description:
Sing a Song

Buffalo Gals

As I was walking down the street
Down the street, down the street,
A little pretty gal I chanced to meet,
Oh she was fair to see.

Chorus
Buffalo Gals, won't you come out tonight,
Come out tonight, come out tonight.
Buffalo Gals, won't you come out tonight
And dance by the light of the moon.

I asked her if she'd have a talk,
Have a talk, have a talk,
Her feet took up the whole sidewalk,
As she stood close to me.

Chorus
Buffalo Gals, won't you come out tonight,
Come out tonight, come out tonight.
Buffalo Gals, won't you come out tonight
And dance by the light of the moon.

I asked her, "Would you want to dance?
Want to dance? Want to dance?"
I thought that I might have a chance
To shake a foot with her.

TumbleBooks

Just Like Josh Gibson - Angela Johnson

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

E is for Exercise

Do a few simple exercises with your child, such as jumping jacks or touching toes. The square dance is South Carolina’s folk dance. Do a square dance and talk about why exercise is important.

Watch

PBS Kids: Mr. Rogers plays Go Stop Go

Explore More

  • Elmo’s First Day of School - Help Elmo get ready for the first day of school!
  • Motivating Kids to Be Active - Help motivate your children to stay active and healthy.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 6
item.description:
Alphabet Rap

A-B- CDE
Down on the farm is where I want to be!
F-G- HIJ
Milking the cows and bringing in the hay!
K-L- MNO
Where the trees and the plants from seedlings grow!
P-Q- RST
Riding a horse across the fields so free!
U-V- WXY
But it's time to leave and say good-bye!
Z-Z- ZZZ
Down at the farm is where I want to be. 

TumbleBooks

Oh, Crumps! - Lee Bock

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

All Letter Day!

Point out the letters you recognize in signs throughout the day.

Watch

Alphabet Monster

Explore More

  • Make an Alphabet Book - This alphabet book idea can be used with pictures from magazines or draw your own pictures!
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 5
item.description:
Sing a Song

The Q Song

Tune: Twinkle, Twinkle Little Star

Q is for queen with a crown on her head,
Q is for quilt that covers my bed
Q is for questions I like asking,
Q is for ducklings quack quack - quacking
Q is for quarter and quick and quill
I like Q and I always will.

TumbleBooks

Read Anything Good Lately? - Susan Allen and Jane Lindaman

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Q is for Quilt

Draw a family quilt on paper and have each family member decorate one or more squares.

Watch

Sesame Street: Queen Quagmire

Explore More

  • Make a Quilt Picture - Use paper in many colors to design a quilt picture.
  • Texture-Triangle Quilt Craft - Use fun textures to make a unique piece of art.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 4
item.description:
Sing a Song

Three Black Cats

Tune: Three Blind Mice

Three black cats, three black cats,
With big green eyes, with big green eyes.
They meow and cry all through the night,
Then jump from the fence and they run in fright,
They hiss at the witches, oh my, what a sight.
Those three black cats!

TumbleBooks

Caillou & Gilbert - Joceline Sanschagrin

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

C is for Cat

Do you have your library card?
Visit your local library!
Read The Cat in the Hat together.

Watch

PBS Kids: The Cat in the Hat Builds a Nest

Explore More

  • StoryPlace presents Pets - Read an online story, play a game, make a craft, and more!
  • Cat Heads - Here is a nifty idea for drawing a cat.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 3
item.description:
Sing a Song

Open and Shut

Open - shut them,
Give a little clap.
Open - shut them,
Open - shut them,
Lay them in your lap.
Roll them, roll them, (roll hands)
Roll them, roll them,
Roll them, just like this.
Wave them, wave them, (wave hands)
Wave them, wave them,
And blow a little kiss.

TumbleBooks

The Night I Followed the Dog - Nina Laden

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

N is for Noodle

Help your child spell his or her name using cooked spaghetti. You can also make all the letters of the alphabet!

Watch

Sesame Street: Mr. Noodle Feeds a Plant

Explore More

  • Colored Noodle Art - Color noodles and decorate to make desktop friends.
  • Noodle Fish - Decorate a hanging fish with multi-colored noodles.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 2
item.description:
Sing a Song

A Fireman

This brave fireman is going to bed
Down on the pillow he lays his head
Wraps himself in his blanket tight
And plans to sleep this way all night
But the fire alarm rings! He opens his eyes!
Quickly he's dressed and down the pole he slides
Then he climbs on the truck to go, go, go.

Watch

Build a Couch Fort!

Try This

F is for Fort

Make a fort with your child out of pillows and blankets.

TumbleBooks

Castle On Hester Street - Linda Heller

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Explore More

  • Make a Firetruck Snack - A few ingredients can turn a cracker into a firetruck!
  • Thorn Rosa and Thorn Ross - Try these two action songs featuring a sleepy princess or a sleepy prince.
item.author: webmaster@lva.virginia.gov (Library of Virginia)

item.title: September 1
item.description:
Sing a Song

ABC

A B C Tumble down D
Cat's in the cupboard
And can't see me
(play peek-a-boo)
A B C Tumble down D
Cat's in the cupboard
And can't see me
(play peek-a-boo)

TumbleBooks

ABC Letters in the Library - Bonnie Farmer

Access TumbleBooks and search for this book title.

Try This

Make an ABC book to work on all month

Fold over paper or cut up pieces of paper until you have 26. Working together, write a letter of the alphabet on the top of each page. Fill in the book with drawings or cut up pictures all month long!

Watch

PBS Kids: Library A-Z

Explore More

  • Bembos Zoo - This unique alphabet site features illustrations created from the letters in each animal's name.
  • Teach Your Child About Letters - Listed are great activity ideas to help your child learn about letters.
